title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Ye H (2023). gdrive.automation: Sync Automate C4R Unit Progress. R package version 0.3.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gdrive.automation: Sync and Automate C4R Unit Progress},   author = {Hao Ye},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.3.0}, }

what: Sync and Automate C4R Unit Progress
title: Sync and Automate C4R Unit Progress
text: goal gdrive-automation automate processing tasks related C4R Shared Drive, aid synchronization states content. Specific actions include: check updates Unit Roadmaps process accordingly (send notifications, update files) check updates Unit Tracking spreadsheet process accordingly (send notifications, update files) send notifications (via CRM API integraton?) log actions log todos (actions taken human)

title: Sync and Automate C4R Unit Progress
text: Data Unit Status shared across two distinct files: Unit Roadmap (“roadmap”) specific unit - google doc overall Unit Tracking spreadsheet (“tracker”) - google sheet data unique roadmap : metadata unit (title, description, mini-units, activities)

title: Sync and Automate C4R Unit Progress
text: roadmap tracker contain status indicators various components / phases unit. (technical limitation pulldown item google doc manipulated API. value can read exporting google doc, however.) 4 states status, generally progresses : “started” -> “Submitted” -> “review” -> “Approved” documentation clarifies resolve situations status particular item different roadmap vs. tracker.

title: Sync and Automate C4R Unit Progress

what: Case 1. Tracker is “further along” than the Roadmap
